comment: too sweet.  Drinkable, but not good IMO
Was OK to drink considering high proof
Incredible! Best bourbon I've had so far. Dark deep caramel flavor, a little hot in the finish but that's to be expected with a proof over 120, will be picking up a bottle when I can
Wow!! Big cinnamon with notes of oak and vanilla mingling.  Bold spice and cinnamon finish along with slight leather profile.
Sweet with a strong taste of vanilla

I haven't had the courage to drink this neat, which is my preferred method of enjoying whiskey. I've never bought a bottle, as I've only drank this while out a restaurants. I drink it on the rocks. The nose is heavenly, with maple, caramel, fruit, and a little sweet corn. The palate shows the wood influence with lots of vanilla to tame the heat. Leather and dark fruits are on the follow through. This bourbon is a complex special treat, for me it's not a nightly sipper, but one to be appreciated occasionally.

Singes the nostrils with a dry, herbal, peaty, spicy nose with fresh cut grass. The palate is intense heat but full of flavor and spice. Peanut shells, leather, oak, and toasted caramel notes come in waves. The finish resolves into dried cherry, and charred oak.
Nice Slight burnt spice but a little burn at finish
Whoa this is INTENSE. All burn up front and spicy in the back. Some water opens this up.
This smacks you in the face, definitely no joke. Delicious though.
Very spicy, needed 3 cubes and 30 minutes to smooth it out.
Strong. Needs to be watered down.
Very intense and rough. I could feel the burn almost 10 minutes after drinking.

Had a double pour at a local restaurant/ bar with friends over dinner last week. I have wanted to try this but didn't want to drop the coin on a bottle. Prices in the area have soared to over $80-$90. Started neat and added a couple of cubes of ice. Flavor was good, picked up some of the baking spice and vanilla and definitely the heat while drinking neat. It hit home like any good cask strength bourbon will. It left me wanting though.... One of my usual higher proof pours is Knob Creek Single Barrel. To me this was so similar it's not worth the jump of double in cost. I really wanted to like this more than what I did. Though enjoyable, I doubt I buy a bottle unless I find a steal of a deal. Owning both a standard bottle and a hand selected bottle of KC Single Barrel I'll get by with those as the profiles are very similar. In truth, this is maybe 3.75-4 when considering the price.

2014-07. All the reasons why I love Booker's. Flavor bomb, nutty, sweet, vanilla, spice. Fills your mouth, your head, your chest. I can drink this without cutting it. 4/7/17 Intense, leather, spice, black cherry. 7/19/17
C07-B-7. Thin nose, smells like clean laundry. Very sweet up front. Strong and sharp wood notes, almost a sour flavor. Not as complex as some other batches, but still delicious. a few drops of water and this seemingly gets oilier, with some additional leather. 6/29/18
Lots of good flavors but very alcohol strong. Like lighter fluid strong.
"My favorite bourbon out of 50 bourbons and ryes, by far. Specifically, I have the Booker's Bluegrass batch (2016-01).

It feels like slaughtering a sacred cow to say that this is merely good rather than great, but...it's good, not great. The nose is spiced orange creme patissiere smeared over leather; the palate is aggressive, woody, and leathery, with caramel, spices, orange peel, and a cherry-tinged finish. For me, this is the date that's very attractive, but comes on just a little too strong. Water brings out a milder, smoother palate with a little nip of salt amidst the leather, oak, spice, and cherry. Improved, but still not the best bourbon I've ever had, either. Then again, I'm the oddball who prefers Baker's to Booker's, so maybe it's just my palate. Still worth drinking, and quite good...just a bit overpriced and overrated.
Surprisingly smooth for being such high proof. Mine was 128 proof. Strong oak and woodsy flavor
VERY warm, all the way, but I really enjoyed sipping on it.  Strong effect, too.

My favorite so far.  Enjoyed on a rock and loved how it opened as the cube melted.  Outstanding start to finish.  I didn't find the burn so many mention, but that's what makes bourbon great.  There's something for everyone. A 4.5 in my book.
Complex, spicy, high proof. Unique and good, but not something I'd want as a daily/casual bourbon.
spicy bold flavor at the beginning, back of the throat linger, floral earthier smell, but not as much of that flavor
Cask strength - how whiskey tasted in the 18th century

Leather nose with notes of caramel & a touch of oak. Caramel flavor with spiceyness. Vanilla finish with notes of caramel & oak. Smooth, no harsh flavors. Batch # C2014-05, 7yrs 5 months & 127.9 proof. Thanks JT.

Batch C07-A-12 

Pretty smooth after taste

My favorite bourbon to take hiking...good ABV%/weight trade-off. Beyond that, I find it delicious. Hot, woody, spicy, in your face. I don't think it's the most delicious bourbon out there or anything, but it's an experience. Water opens it up, but there's something that just feels right about sipping it neat and feeling all that spicy warmth flood my mouth and sinuses. I prefer Scotch most of the time, and the thought of paying Scotch prices for bourbon these days is a bit off-putting, but for Booker's I make an exception.
Very strong bite needs water or ice
Had it in a flight at ________. Hot like rocket fuel.
Reminds me of Creme brule. Starts off strong but ends smooth. Caramel notes. Great value for your money
Nose is a lot of cherries when left to sit with some ice. A lot of warming heat (rye?) with cinnamon and cloves on the finish
had this bourbon with a cigar today and I tasted the sweetness over all else. I definitely think the cigar helped to mitigate the burn most people experience with this one. four stars for sure.
I don't which Booker's batch I've tried! Just on the rocks in a bar. This is my gold standard of bourbon.
Strong start, long finish. Very oaky and subtle cherry finish.

A huge hit of leather, rich toasted oak, toffee, and a bit floral. Kind of like Blanton’s, turned up to 11, more leather. Excellent flavour. It packs a punch but it’s certainly not as harsh as the ABV would suggest. Unfortunately it’s hard to find... $100 in Ontario.
Love every variation of Booker's I've had to this point. Definitely my favorite.
Very good whiskey not sure what to compare it to but it's very good

Nose: Vanilla essence, baked apples, orange zest, treacle (almost cola-like), floral notes. Some warm cooking spices - cumin, cardamon, turmeric. Berries, fresh leather - like the smell of a leather coat shop. Deep down there is some oak and an aniseed scent.

  Palate: A spicy-sweet arrival with toffee, allspice, ginger, sweet chili and lime essence. Aniseed again (hmmm, how much rye is in this?). 90% chocolate with orange oil, a sweet and spicy baked custard served with strongly brewed English breakfast tea. Licorice, treacle tart, and cinnamon. Very complex.

   Finish: Medium, less length than I'd anticipated, ending with a lightly peppery, spicy-sweet liquorice.

  Very satisfying at all stages. I got little vanilla from this except on the initial sniff, and the more water you add the more it fades. The official tasting notes bore little resemblance to my experience, however as this is a batch thing that's understandable. It also changes character noticeably as it is diluted, from very spicy down to sweet. Finding the right balance for you is the key here, and it's worth it.

  I'd strongly encourage anyone tasting this to add water. Tasting it neat will anaesthetise your taste buds and numb your palate for a good 15 minutes. I preferred it cut down to around 46% at which point it's eminently approachable and the sweet part of the character can be explored.

  The wood influence is very well handled - it's neither spirit nor wood driven, but there is a subtle astringency from the oak tannins that is perfect. I suspect it is one of the factors the warehouse managers look for when selecting the casks for this expression. This is a high-class whiskey, deserving of its reputation, but to tell the truth I almost prefer Baker's Bourbon for its more approachable, unashamed woody character.

"Very Good" : 4 stars
Nose: the most appealing whiskey ever by smell? - a ton of chocolate and oak.  Much spicier on tongue, oak remains w leather.  Boozy, bold, and a must try.
Didn’t fully understand what people meant by “complexity” until I tried Bookers a second time. Under the fire lies lots of tastebud adventure.

Batch No C07-A-12
Classification: Kentucky Straight Bourbon
Proof: 130.6 (65.3%)
Age: 7 Years
Mashbill: Corn 77%, Rye 13%, Malted Barley 10%
Distillery: Jim Beam Distillery, Clermont, KY
Price: $70 - $90
Color: Medium Amber
Nose: Strong alcohol, oak, nutty
Palate: Pleasantly sweet, leather, oak vanilla
Finish: Long, velvety, oak, leather, warm
Personal Rating: 9.5/10
Notes: Booker’s is probably in my top three favorite bourbons. The price tag can sometimes seem a little steep, but in my opinion it is worth it. For me, I describe the flavor as very “masculine,” which I am partial to with my bourbons. Due to the high proof, I recommend enjoying this on the rocks or with a splash of water to open up the palate...but of course you know I’ll be drinking it neat. What can I say? I love the Kentucky hug

Nose is vanilla and citrus with a little peppermint 

Hot on the palate with some caramel corn with some orange very warming 

Finish is a little dry and one note

Good but not great
a couple cubes release the inner sweet, almost cinnamon roll quality. this is not for the meek, but choose it and you're rewarded.
a little harsh at first, but smooth flavor
oily, rich and spicy. sticks to tongue and burns
Batch C07-B-7. Really good with ice. Nice sipping bourbon.
Very spicy and oaky on the nose. Spicy taste. The cask strength is no joke. A splash of water really opens up the flavors.
Nose of oak and Carmel. Taste of spice and leather oak and some vanilla. There is some alcohol burn. But not so bad on the rocks. Long finish
Lots of big, bold, hot flavor. Hard to pick out anything particular underneath the proof, gonna try with water next time.

So potent and explosively sweet that it’s almost overwhelming. How is it so smooth on the finish though? It’s like magic. 

Is it the best bourbon in the world? I don’t think so. But I’d definitely take someone seriously if they argued it was.
Just too much.  Brash, and spicy.
My go to for a decade. Fantastic flavor for 62% with spice, heat, caramel, and a full nose.  Perfect with a little ice to open it up.

Nose: Caramel, vanilla,hot leather, dark fruits, Lemon peel, and burnt 
corn

With ice I’m getting some maraschino cherry’s

Palate: corn, caramel, oak, and leather

Finish: long, leather, and oak

A favorite high proof bourbon. Punches you in the throat
Enjoyable. Had a few drams while visiting Yosemite with Lisa.
Big Alcohol burn followed by a long smooth finish full of lots of flavors. Sip it.
2017-03: tons of apple sweetness and brown sugar. Incredibly and approachable at the 62.5(ish) love this and NEED MORE
Another hefty bourbon, the complexity is it's strength. Used to be reasonably priced, but hard to bauy a bottle at $80 when similarly ranked bourbons are available in the $50-$60 range.

Golden Amber color
Sweet Corn, Vanilla, Cinnamon aroma
Slight sweetness on the front, Hot and spicy on the finish. 

To hot and spicy. Not liking the heat from this one.
Real strong with a mule kick at the end
This bourbon is awful is just spicy and nothing else. maybe keep this for a Manhattan or an Old fashion but is just not good straight or even with ice
Hint of cinnamon, very smooth - similar to Four Roses
Intense. Sweet start with a woody flavor.
A bit sweet, but pretty good
Best barrel proof that’s still easy to find.
Slight woody on nose.  Bit spicy with black pepper, good Kentucky Kiss.  Not bad, but my tasted go to a more wheated drink.
On the rocks nice after a little melt
Despite the cask strength it’s incredibly smooth to drink neat. A strong sense of oak and stone fruits.
Had at Whiskey Club for birthday with Julie.   Very bold.  Perhaps good in a mixed drink.
This was great and would make awesome old fashioneds
Long finish. Spices, leather, Tobacco, dried fruits. Really enjoy the complexity of this juice. Not for the faint of heart.

Batch 2017-01E
6 Years 1 Month
62.7% ABV / 125.4° Proof
—//—
On the nose is intense, dark brown sugar caramel, cinnamon, vanilla, oak, leather and a hint of smoky barrel char.  Sweet and spicy root beer with a strong alcoholic tingle.
-
To the palate it is incredibly dense and powerfully alcoholic.  Rich, sweet dark caramel and spicy cinnamon makes for a very intense and warming dram.
-
In the finish the warmth and oak reside with tingling spices and vanilla.
—
With water the nose really opens up revealing heightened versions of all the initial aromas with particularly more prominent oak and spice notes, as well as candies orange peel and ginger.
-
Still powerful on the palate, now tingling across my entire tongue, top and bottom, sweeter and spicier with some candied ginger notes appearing, leading to a more dry oak finish.
—//—
Bourbon Mark:  94
—//—
Water is essential to fully exploring this whisky.  Definitely something you need to take your time with.  It’s among the very best bourbons I have tasted.
Very buttery and smooth at the front, with a strong vanilla and caramel finish
Very vanilla, slightly corny perhaps, a little hot
Kinda strong and less flavorful than expected, but still decent
Started with a high citrus nose. Oak notes and a little note on the from with a toned down finish with leather notes.
Has way too much spice, almost ginger like.
Really good, super smooth, but just a little too strong for my liking.
Round and full. Long finish. Not as bitey.
Added a few drops of water made it drinkable.  The water brought out the notes of vanilla and spice.  Experienced it neat. I would drink again.
Supposedly small batch. Oak chalk taste with sweet and light salt. I love it.

nose: Strong spice, oak, leather, hints of vanilla and cherry

tasting: oak leather and spice; toffee caramel and vanilla; and cherries on the back end

finish: cask strength shines through with evaporative finish, heat, spice, leather
Strong ethanol finish. Long dry after taste of oak and fruit.
Tried neat, and it was REALLY strong. Much better tasting and smoother on the rocks. will definitely drink again!
Really nice. Tons of fruit on the palate with heat that lingers on the top of the tongue. A few drops of water being lit some vanilla on the nose.
This bourbon will melt your face and steal your soul. Four stars.

Very good bourbon, but wouldn't it pay $60.00 for it again. At 122 proof it is very strong. To me, it is woody, peppery, spicy, full, and oily. Is it it just my impression that these higher proof whiskies have more oil and smoke? It is noticeable even after watering it down to 90 proof or so.
Stout and bananas depending on the batch ;)
Definitely got the burn more so than I remembered from last time. Full bodied. Needs some ice for sure for me
Maybe it was the expectation leading up to this whiskey but I was pretty disappointed. Tasted like almost all alcohol and burn at first. Not opposed to giving a second try.
Add some ice let mellow and enjoy this complex bourbon

A really good bold tasting bitter at first taste. Super smooth finish with lingering light burn. Strong note of Carmel and leather. 

Great aroma, sweet and warm

Delicious, complex, lots of fruit and honey without being overly sweet. The high profile is. To obvious on the nose or the finish. I really enjoyed this Bourbon and plan to add a bottle to my cabinet.
Pretty pricey in the Nashville area but a really good pour. Nice bite with fairly full body of flavors. Finish is not too long but certainly enjoyable.
Mixed w water to get alcohol percentage down. Vanilla, Carmel, oak, spice, long finish.
I‘m not into Burbon vit this one is superbe.
Very faint vanilla on the nose. Caramel and citrus followed instantly with harsh heat on the tongue. A few drops of water brought the harsh character to an enjoyable measure.

A healthy slap in the face.

Oak and leather with hints of cherry on the nose.

Spice and leather cover your entire mouth, and finish with more oak and hints of green apple on the finish.
Smooth with a slightly strange after taste

Holy. Remember when I said Stagg Jr would melt the skin of a velociraptor? This stuff will melt their bones. Avoid eye contact and flush immediately with water if contact occurs.

Seriously hot. I'm sure there's good flavors to be found. Unfortunately my sample was so small that even with a little water on my second sip, I still really only had heat and oak.

Hot, spicy, and lovely

Whiskey Wednesday!!
heavy toffee and dark fruit, leather, spice and alcohol heat on the finish
Medium heat for a barrel proof. Vanilla, spice, oily. Mild finish. Solid!
Excellent.  One of the most balanced whiskeys I’ve ever experienced.

Great high proof bourbon - not as hot as Stagg Jr. but every bit as complex. Drank half of the pour neat before discovering it was bottled ~61% abv and didn’t even notice.

The nose is oak-y, with spice and vanilla coming forward first followed by a cherry aroma.

The palate picks up a bit of spice, a lot of the oak and leather described and trails off into a rich tobacco finish that probably changes 2-3 more times before fading out.

I’m intrigued by this one! Try it without water first but I do recommend a splash to spread the flavors/aromas out.

Smells strongly of oak and leather notes, tastes of traditional bourbon char a hint of sweetness and a long lasting hum.

Upon introducing water the smell of sweetness intensifies, the taste of sweetness is increased before developing into a char burn.

I preferred this un bloomed

I added an ice cube and it emphasised the caramel notes, in the best of ways
Honestly not my jam. Hits rich with a lot of spice, but there’s nothing smooth or sweet to mellow it out.
Everything a bourbon should be. Requires ice or a splash of water to open it up. Then it’s all caramel and vanilla. Pleasing burn to it as well.
Great taste once you get passed the high proof burn

Alcohol on the nose 
Initial bite of the alcohol followed by vanilla 
Long finish of wood

Sweet and welcoming on the nose with hints of vanilla & maple. The pallet had a very quick heat from the proof so that lends itself to some warming spice characteristics. I get cherry, oak, and tobacco on the taste with a very long finish. To me it’s not very oily or heavy but does have a lingering burn and spicy finish. Not bad but couldn’t drink it often.

Nose: vanilla, oak and spice.

Palate: Strong when enjoyed neat. Had a hint of vanilla and spice with oak and leather.

Finish: It had a loonnngggg finish and could note cherry with oak and leather. 

Worth purchasing a bottle to enjoy for a very special occasion.
Rich and very strong with some really nice notes of vanilla, leather and cherry. Pretty good but needs water or ice to tame it
Spicey first taste but then great
Very strong (even on the rocks), but great flavors. Would like to try near with a couple drops of water.
Lots of ethanol. Good smoke and caramel flavors

There is a ton of vanilla on the nose, very noticeable even though you can't stay in the glass too long. There's also a caramel sweetness that reminded me of taffy and a bit of oak underneath. It should be no surprise, but this whiskey kicks. On the first taste I got nothing but salted peanuts in the shell. I got a hint of cherry lurking on the edges before the heat rolled in. Second taste wasn't nearly as overwhelming and had more oak and vanilla with a creamy-char sweetness that I couldn't put my finger on but tasted like something nostalgic. A couple drops of water cools the dram down and brings out the barrel notes while tamping the sweetness down. The cherry becomes more muddled with other dark fruits and the salted peanuts return on the finish and linger for awhile.

Ok, this bourbon was a present - it’s a little outside my normal price range. Having said that, I may need to rethink that rule for some special occasions. 

Love the full flavor and nice spice. I don’t taste as much vanilla as Expert but it’s there nonetheless. 

Great flavors- caramel, oak. Great finish - lingers nicely on pallet. 

I’ll repeat for right occasion.

Tasting the 2018-02 “Backyard BBQ” bottling.

Nose is very soft with loads of vanilla, caramel with some underlying cherry notes.

Silky smooth mouthfeel, and a bit spicier on the finish but nothing close to what you’d expect from a 128.8 proof spirit.

A touch of smokiness and woody character along with leather rounds out the sweetness of the vanilla and caramel.
Oak, vanilla,  medium bite, little caramel

This is hot number with char and fire and smoke. Ice and some more ice allows it to open up with some sweetness and vanilla but it’s not an everyday sipper. Might be nice to have on a cold day after getting into a bar fight.
Cereal and vanilla nose. Caramel, and woody with some apple pie.

Kicks you in the teeth! Really sweet and rich. Lots of caramel. But the high proof is noticeable. Quite good. 

8.50 USD per pour
Capital Ale House
Big, Spicy, peppery, cinnamon. Wood wood wood. Huge oak char. Long burning finish. Warming and cozy.
Very strong so are some water to open up. Caramel and vanilla on the nose. Sweet with strong oak taste. After taste lingers and is pleasant.
Good. Full bodies. Some corn flavor and moderately sweet.

Because of its strong alcohol level, it does have a significant bite. I like it along the lines of a Knob Creek. While the initial essence was of leather, caramel, apples and spices, I could only detect def. Apple and maybe caramel. They say that this bourbon is not for the weak...they are correct.
Corn forward, raisin, plenty of sweetness
More fruit on the palate than on the finish for me
I think this is better than the 3.9 average score. Love the burn, nice flavor
A very smooth and delicious bourbon.
Burn 5 minutes later. Not my thing.
Earthy flavor, no sweetness. With water, becomes more spicy.
Had this is an old fashioned. Initially came off strong, almost like a scotch. Smoothed out quickly. Loved the flavor with this one.
2017-01 Ridiculously full and complex. Pretty much coats your teeth. Lots to love and think about.

This is definitely a man’s bourbon. Lots of oakiness and leather up front with a bit of vanilla sweetness backing it up. The taste lingers on the tongue for quite a while before opening up into some beautiful cherry notes

The nose is not as hot as you might expect but there is some heat, also some spice and maybe some red fruit and a hint of vanilla. Flavors of caramel, I can imagine leather and tobacco, and a hint of cherry. Warming but not overly hot.
Definitely warms you up.  Good amount of oak, char and normal bourbon flavors

lots of maple (syrup), oak, vanilla on the nose
A few drops of water, almost brings more heat out
Dropped a ice ball, definitely more enjoyable 

Packs a lot of heat
Host hard but well worth it.
Good upfront,  but the ending was a bit much
Strong, oak, overpowers a CT wrapper cigar.  Nice burn on the Finnish, like with ice.
Easy drinking nightcap in GB prohibition bar.
Remarkably smooth & sweet for the high ABV.

Barrel and corn dominate the nose, vanilla and dark caramel.  Hints of rye and barn must.
Biting, hot front tempered by a few drops of water. Some spice comes through mid palate and the barrel comes back again. Long warming finish with notes of chocolate and stored oak logs.  This has incredible balance and far beyond average complexity.

Really well balanced, yet very hot.  Benefits a lot from a dash of water makes it easier to find all the other things going on.

Long finish took along time to dissipate(good).

Lots of oak, and leather start, vanilla really became playful with Carmel and I wanna say cherry/full fruity flavours. Finished with a nice spice/wood/vanilla.

Was very well balanced it transitioned very nicely from note to note.

Only detractor was it was so hot I couldn’t taste much until I opened it up

Received as a gift from my older brother before I knew the first thing about bourbon. As a result did not fully appreciate it but from my memory, a bit hot and not quite as smooth as I needed at that point. Will need to try again

Nose: Warm Allspice, Vanilla, Toffee
Palate:
Forward- Cinnamon and Nutmeg. Hot Spice Bomb, compliments Corn Bread Sweetness. Peppery.
Finish- Candied Walnut and Charred Cherry.
High vanilla, full, spicy, can’t drive home
Surprisingly smooth given the high proof. Lots of caramel flavor. Opens up better with ice. Somewhat smoky
Big alcohol punch. A little vanilla and oaky spices. Long finish

The nose of this bourbon carries a sweet spiciness to it featuring notes of cinnamon that bleed into vanilla and caramel.

On the palate there is a sweet vanilla that transitions into a woody profile.  It finishes with a bit of leather.
Spicy, with a bit of a nut base and little vanilla. Spicy, long lasting finish.
Original bottle from 1989 at Willett distillery.  $100 an ounce and worth every penny.  So smooth rich flavor
Thick oily mouthfeel, savory steak and potatoe dinner, ethanol, nutmeg anise and rye spice. Long nutty finish.
Really good. Very smooth. Not very spicy, but lots of oak flavor.
Very intense- benefits from a bit of water - reminds me of leather arm chairs and manly things. Mother’s Day present??

Nose is very sweet. I expected a POW from the high proof but it was great. Not overwhelming at all. Incredibly long finish that had several changes spicy, oak and sweet. Not for faint of heart but not boring. I’m a fan!
Smooth.  Deep.  Well balanced.  One of the best ever.   No burn
Really nice vanilla nose and flavor with a little caramel
2014-07. Nose is nice but palate is a bit...vegetal?

Nose =  lots of leather, hard for me to pick up much else 
Palate = smooth, silky burn. Cinnamon, licorice.
Initially a little spike-y but it mellowed and was interesting and delicious. Need more.
Back in the day when Booker was still alive and this was “reasonably priced” at like $55, it was just about the best bourbon under $75 on earth.  No longer, but still amazing even at $100.
